fact_check_explanation_title: Articles claiming Amazon is encouraging users to sign up to cryptocurrency platform are fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: because Amazon has not launched a cryptocurrency trading platform under either of these names.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about injured dog in Tyneside uses old picture from Australia
fact_check_explanation_summary: Multiple posts claim the dog was found in different UK locations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that Pfizer vaccine wasn’t tested on preventing transmission need context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Post-trial studies showed the Covid-19 vaccine offered some protection against transmission of early variants.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral picture is not of cameras that can detect drivers on mobile phones
fact_check_explanation_summary: National Highways confirmed that the cameras pictured were to monitor all lane running smart motorways.

fact_check_explanation_title: How might the Retained EU Law Bill affect our right to watch the Olympics for free?
fact_check_explanation_summary: In PMQs, Labour MP Stella Creasy claimed the Retained EU Law Bill would ‘abolish’ the right to watch the Olympics for free. The government told Full Fact that this wouldn’t …

fact_check_explanation_title: Deaths due to SADS aren’t covering up ‘genocide’ caused by Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence that Covid-19 vaccines are causing people to die of SADS, or that deaths due to the Covid-19 vaccine are being misreported as SADS as part of …

fact_check_explanation_title: The facts around former PMs’ £115,000 annual ‘allowance’
fact_check_explanation_summary: They are allowed to claim back up to £115,000 each year for the costs associated with continuing public duties—but it’s not a “salary”.

fact_check_explanation_title: A letter from the Prime Minister wasn’t mistakenly signed by Kwasi Kwarteng
fact_check_explanation_summary: Liz Truss’s letter to the former chancellor followed the convention of similar letters sent by her predecessor Boris Johnson.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Injured’ man in fake post is popular YouTuber
fact_check_explanation_summary: The image is three years old and relates to a medical emergency, not a car accident.

fact_check_explanation_title: Private Eye did not say Kwasi Kwarteng was paid £20,000 a month by a hedge fund
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims circulating on social media don’t reflect what was reported by the magazine, or what’s recorded in the Register of Members’ Financial Interests.

fact_check_explanation_title: Old picture of Jacob Rees-Mogg in 2018 scuffle going viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo taken in 2018 is being mistakenly shared as being from recent events in Parliament.

fact_check_explanation_title: Halloween Cadbury chocolate hamper offer is not genuine
fact_check_explanation_summary: An alleged offer posted on Facebook has no connection with Cadbury despite claiming to.
